work.p: This lines were apparently drafted as part of the poem published on March 6, 1848, in the New Orleans Daily Crescent as "The Mississippi at Midnight." A greatly revised version of the poem was later included in Specimen Days & Collect (1882–3).

titleStmt.title: Like Earth O River
a machine readable transcription

notesStmt.note: This lines were probably drafted as part of the poem published as "The Mississippi at Midnight" on March 6, 1848, in the New Orleans Daily Crescent, though they were not included in the published version of the poem. A revised version of the poem, titled "Sailing the Mississippi at Midnight," was later included in Specimen Days & Collect (1882–3). Whitman left for New Orleans in February, 1848, so this manuscript was written after that date.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Like Earth O River, you offer us burial
bibl.orgName: The Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature, New York Public Library
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.
Draft lines on the back of this manuscript leaf also relate to the poem eventually titled "Sailing the Mississippi at Midnight."

lg.l: Like Earth O river, you offer us burial
Like Existence mortal Life is your aimless hurrying on
Like Time, with a clutch remorseless, continual
That which you take is forever gone.
Unlike Time, you begin and end,
Unlike Life you've a pathway steady
Unlike Earth's are your numberless graves
